11#ifndef MEDIA_SCTP_USRSCTP_TRANSPORT_H_
12#define MEDIA_SCTP_USRSCTP_TRANSPORT_H_
13
14#include <errno.h>
15
16#include <cstdint>
17#include <map>
18#include <memory>
19#include <set>
20#include <string>
21#include <vector>
22
23#include "absl/types/optional.h"
24#include "rtc_base/buffer.h"
25#include "rtc_base/constructor_magic.h"
26#include "rtc_base/copy_on_write_buffer.h"
27#include "rtc_base/task_utils/pending_task_safety_flag.h"
28#include "rtc_base/third_party/sigslot/sigslot.h"
29#include "rtc_base/thread.h"
30// For SendDataParams/ReceiveDataParams.
31#include "media/base/media_channel.h"
32#include "media/sctp/sctp_transport_internal.h"
33
34// Defined by "usrsctplib/usrsctp.h"
35struct sockaddr_conn;
36struct sctp_assoc_change;
37struct sctp_rcvinfo;
38struct sctp_stream_reset_event;
39struct sctp_sendv_spa;
40
41// Defined by <sys/socket.h>
42struct socket;
43namespace cricket {
44
45// Holds data to be passed on to a transport.
46struct SctpInboundPacket;
47
48// From transport calls, data flows like this:
49// [network thread (although it can in princple be another thread)]
50// 1. SctpTransport::SendData(data)
51// 2. usrsctp_sendv(data)
52// [network thread returns; sctp thread then calls the following]
53// 3. OnSctpOutboundPacket(wrapped_data)
54// [sctp thread returns having async invoked on the network thread]
55// 4. SctpTransport::OnPacketFromSctpToNetwork(wrapped_data)
56// 5. DtlsTransport::SendPacket(wrapped_data)
57// 6. ... across network ... a packet is sent back ...
58// 7. SctpTransport::OnPacketReceived(wrapped_data)
59// 8. usrsctp_conninput(wrapped_data)
60// [network thread returns; sctp thread then calls the following]
61// 9. OnSctpInboundData(data)
62// 10. SctpTransport::OnDataFromSctpToTransport(data)
63// [sctp thread returns having async invoked on the network thread]
64// 11. SctpTransport::OnDataFromSctpToTransport(data)
65// 12. SctpTransport::SignalDataReceived(data)
66// [from the same thread, methods registered/connected to
67// SctpTransport are called with the recieved data]
68class UsrsctpTransport : public SctpTransportInternal,
69 public sigslot::has_slots<> {
70 public:
71 // |network_thread| is where packets will be processed and callbacks from
72 // this transport will be posted, and is the only thread on which public
73 // methods can be called.
74 // |transport| is not required (can be null).
75 UsrsctpTransport(rtc::Thread* network_thread,
76 rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport);
77 ~UsrsctpTransport() override;
78
79 // SctpTransportInternal overrides (see sctptransportinternal.h for comments).
80 void SetDtlsTransport(rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport) override;
81 bool Start(int local_port, int remote_port, int max_message_size) override;
82 bool OpenStream(int sid) override;
83 bool ResetStream(int sid) override;
84 bool SendData(int sid,
85 const webrtc::SendDataParams& params,
86 const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer& payload,
87 SendDataResult* result = nullptr) override;
88 bool ReadyToSendData() override;
89 int max_message_size() const override { return max_message_size_; }
90 absl::optional<int> max_outbound_streams() const override {
91 return max_outbound_streams_;
92 }
93 absl::optional<int> max_inbound_streams() const override {
94 return max_inbound_streams_;
95 }
96 void set_debug_name_for_testing(const char* debug_name) override {
97 debug_name_ = debug_name;
98 }
99 void InjectDataOrNotificationFromSctpForTesting(const void* data,
100 size_t length,
101 struct sctp_rcvinfo rcv,
102 int flags);
103
104 // Exposed to allow Post call from c-callbacks.
105 // TODO(deadbeef): Remove this or at least make it return a const pointer.
106 rtc::Thread* network_thread() const { return network_thread_; }
107
108 private:
109 // A message to be sent by the sctp library. This class is used to track the
110 // progress of writing a single message to the sctp library in the presence of
111 // partial writes. In this case, the Advance() function is provided in order
112 // to advance over what has already been accepted by the sctp library and
113 // avoid copying the remaining partial message buffer.
114 class OutgoingMessage {
115 public:
116 OutgoingMessage(const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer& buffer,
117 int sid,
118 const webrtc::SendDataParams& send_params)
119 : buffer_(buffer), sid_(sid), send_params_(send_params) {}
120
121 // Advances the buffer by the incremented amount. Must not advance further
122 // than the current data size.
123 void Advance(size_t increment) {
124 RTC_DCHECK_LE(increment + offset_, buffer_.size());
125 offset_ += increment;
126 }
127
128 size_t size() const { return buffer_.size() - offset_; }
129
130 const void* data() const { return buffer_.data() + offset_; }
131
132 int sid() const { return sid_; }
133 webrtc::SendDataParams send_params() const { return send_params_; }
134
135 private:
136 const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer buffer_;
137 int sid_;
138 const webrtc::SendDataParams send_params_;
139 size_t offset_ = 0;
140 };
141
142 void ConnectTransportSignals();
143 void DisconnectTransportSignals();
144
145 // Creates the socket and connects.
146 bool Connect();
147
148 // Returns false when opening the socket failed.
149 bool OpenSctpSocket();
150 // Helpet method to set socket options.
151 bool ConfigureSctpSocket();
152 // Sets |sock_ |to nullptr.
153 void CloseSctpSocket();
154
155 // Sends a SCTP_RESET_STREAM for all streams in closing_ssids_.
156 bool SendQueuedStreamResets();
157
158 // Sets the "ready to send" flag and fires signal if needed.
159 void SetReadyToSendData();
160
161 // Sends the outgoing buffered message that was only partially accepted by the
162 // sctp lib because it did not have enough space. Returns true if the entire
163 // buffered message was accepted by the sctp lib.
164 bool SendBufferedMessage();
165
166 // Tries to send the |payload| on the usrsctp lib. The message will be
167 // advanced by the amount that was sent.
168 SendDataResult SendMessageInternal(OutgoingMessage* message);
169
170 // Callbacks from DTLS transport.
171 void OnWritableState(rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport);
172 virtual void OnPacketRead(rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport,
173 const char* data,
174 size_t len,
175 const int64_t& packet_time_us,
176 int flags);
177 void OnClosed(rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport);
178
179 // Methods related to usrsctp callbacks.
180 void OnSendThresholdCallback();
181 sockaddr_conn GetSctpSockAddr(int port);
182
183 // Called using |invoker_| to send packet on the network.
184 void OnPacketFromSctpToNetwork(const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer& buffer);
185
186 // Called on the network thread.
187 // Flags are standard socket API flags (RFC 6458).
188 void OnDataOrNotificationFromSctp(const void* data,
189 size_t length,
190 struct sctp_rcvinfo rcv,
191 int flags);
192 // Called using |invoker_| to decide what to do with the data.
193 void OnDataFromSctpToTransport(const ReceiveDataParams& params,
194 const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer& buffer);
195 // Called using |invoker_| to decide what to do with the notification.
196 void OnNotificationFromSctp(const rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer& buffer);
197 void OnNotificationAssocChange(const sctp_assoc_change& change);
198
199 void OnStreamResetEvent(const struct sctp_stream_reset_event* evt);
200
201 // Responsible for marshalling incoming data to the transports listeners, and
202 // outgoing data to the network interface.
203 rtc::Thread* network_thread_;
204 // Helps pass inbound/outbound packets asynchronously to the network thread.
205 webrtc::ScopedTaskSafety task_safety_;
206 // Underlying DTLS transport.
207 rtc::PacketTransportInternal* transport_ = nullptr;
208
209 // Track the data received from usrsctp between callbacks until the EOR bit
210 // arrives.
211 rtc::CopyOnWriteBuffer partial_incoming_message_;
212 ReceiveDataParams partial_params_;
213 int partial_flags_;
214 // A message that was attempted to be sent, but was only partially accepted by
215 // usrsctp lib with usrsctp_sendv() because it cannot buffer the full message.
216 // This occurs because we explicitly set the EOR bit when sending, so
217 // usrsctp_sendv() is not atomic.
218 absl::optional<OutgoingMessage> partial_outgoing_message_;
219
220 bool was_ever_writable_ = false;
221 int local_port_ = kSctpDefaultPort;
222 int remote_port_ = kSctpDefaultPort;
223 int max_message_size_ = kSctpSendBufferSize;
224 struct socket* sock_ = nullptr; // The socket created by usrsctp_socket(...).
225
226 // Has Start been called? Don't create SCTP socket until it has.
227 bool started_ = false;
228 // Are we ready to queue data (SCTP socket created, and not blocked due to
229 // congestion control)? Different than |transport_|'s "ready to send".
230 bool ready_to_send_data_ = false;
231
232 // Used to keep track of the status of each stream (or rather, each pair of
233 // incoming/outgoing streams with matching IDs). It's specifically used to
234 // keep track of the status of resets, but more information could be put here
235 // later.
236 //
237 // See datachannel.h for a summary of the closing procedure.
238 struct StreamStatus {
239 // Closure initiated by application via ResetStream? Note that
240 // this may be true while outgoing_reset_initiated is false if the outgoing
241 // reset needed to be queued.
242 bool closure_initiated = false;
243 // Whether we've initiated the outgoing stream reset via
244 // SCTP_RESET_STREAMS.
245 bool outgoing_reset_initiated = false;
246 // Whether usrsctp has indicated that the incoming/outgoing streams have
247 // been reset. It's expected that the peer will reset its outgoing stream
248 // (our incoming stream) after receiving the reset for our outgoing stream,
249 // though older versions of chromium won't do this. See crbug.com/559394
250 // for context.
251 bool outgoing_reset_complete = false;
252 bool incoming_reset_complete = false;
253
254 // Some helper methods to improve code readability.
255 bool is_open() const {
256 return !closure_initiated && !incoming_reset_complete &&
257 !outgoing_reset_complete;
258 }
259 // We need to send an outgoing reset if the application has closed the data
260 // channel, or if we received a reset of the incoming stream from the
261 // remote endpoint, indicating the data channel was closed remotely.
262 bool need_outgoing_reset() const {
263 return (incoming_reset_complete || closure_initiated) &&
264 !outgoing_reset_initiated;
265 }
266 bool reset_complete() const {
267 return outgoing_reset_complete && incoming_reset_complete;
268 }
269 };
270
271 // Entries should only be removed from this map if |reset_complete| is
272 // true.
273 std::map<uint32_t, StreamStatus> stream_status_by_sid_;
274
275 // A static human-readable name for debugging messages.
276 const char* debug_name_ = "UsrsctpTransport";
277 // Hides usrsctp interactions from this header file.
278 class UsrSctpWrapper;
279 // Number of channels negotiated. Not set before negotiation completes.
280 absl::optional<int> max_outbound_streams_;
281 absl::optional<int> max_inbound_streams_;
282
283 // Used for associating this transport with the underlying sctp socket in
284 // various callbacks.
285 uintptr_t id_ = 0;
286
287 friend class UsrsctpTransportMap;
288
289 RTC_DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(UsrsctpTransport);
290};
291
292class UsrsctpTransportMap;
293
294} // namespace cricket
295
296#endif // MEDIA_SCTP_USRSCTP_TRANSPORT_H_
